body.head.byline: Special to The New York Times

block.p: Go-Video Inc. said two defendants in its antitrust case had settled by paying the company $3.5 million. The two defendants that settled were the Sanyo Electric Company and the NEC Corporation, both of Japan. The trial against the remaining defendants -- the Sony Corporation, the Matsushita Electric Industrial Company and the Victor Company, all also of Japan -- is scheduled to begin on April 2.

Go-Video, based in Scottsdale, Ariz., contends the companies conspired to prevent the development and sale of its patented VCR-2. The machine can play one tape while recording another or can tape two programs simultaneously.
